findings.title: Lock wallet functionality
findings.description: The smart contract owner can lock or unlock the smart contract.

findings.title: Unprotected functions (transfer, approve, transferFrom, increaseAllowance, decreaseAllowance, lockWallet, deliver)
findings.description: The contract contains unprotected functions that can be exploited by malicious actors.

findings.title: Exclude/include from reward functionality
findings.description: The 'isExcludedFromFee' function allows an owner to exclude/include addresses from reward functionality, which can lead to unintended behavior if not properly managed.

findings.title: Exclude/from max tx functionality
findings.description: Smart contract owner can change max transaction limit without any arbitrary limit set.

findings.title: Exclude/from wallet cap functionality
findings.description: The smart contract lacks functionality to limit the number of tokens a non-whitelisted wallet can hold and the number of transactions it can make within 24 hours.

findings.title: Exclude/from sell limits functionality
findings.description: The smart contract owner can change transaction fees and max transaction limit without arbitrary limits set.

findings.title: Set max per wallet functionality
findings.description: The smart contract owner can set a specified number of tokens that a non-whitelisted wallet can hold.
